definition: sky clears after rain/new hopes after a disastrous period (idiom)/every cloud has a silver lining (idiom)/see also 雨過天青|雨过天青[yu3 guo4 tian1 qing1]
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: After the rain when it is sunny again, layers of clouds make the sky look very beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 雨过天晴，层层云锦把天空点缀得很美丽。

sentences.english: It rained and now the rain is over.
sentences.chinese: 曾经下雨，如今雨过天晴。

sentences.english: As long as you do not give up, then there is rain there will always be things one day.
sentences.chinese: 只要你不放弃，那么事情就总会有雨过天晴的一天。

sentences.english: Once the storm is over, eagle rock sounds cheerful again uncertain in Murakami.
sentences.chinese: 雨过天晴，岩鹰欢快的叫声重又在村上飘忽。

sentences.english: When it's over, so they say, it'll rain a sunny day.
sentences.chinese: 但当它结束的时候，他们说，这就是雨过天晴。

sentences.english: Organizers certainly hope that with opening ceremonies Sunday, the glow will wipe out the gloom.
sentences.chinese: 组织者显然希望周日的开幕会能够让一切雨过天晴。

sentences.english: We shelter under a tree until the shower passed .
sentences.chinese: 我们在树下躲雨，一直躲到雨过天晴。

definition: sky clears after rain/new hopes after a disastrous period (idiom)/every cloud has a silver lining (idiom)/see also 雨過天晴|雨过天晴[yu3 guo4 tian1 qing2]
moderate wind, beautiful sun (idiom); fine sunny weather, esp. in springtime
Heaven is cooperating (idiom)/the weather is favorable for the planned activity (a variation of 天公不作美|天公不作美[tian1 gong1 bu4 zuo4 mei3])
the clouds melt and the mists disperse (idiom)/to clear up/to vanish into thin air
(idiom) sunlight shines over all things/drenched in sunlight
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
